Detect and prevent fraud in your website: Detect and prevent fraud in your website or app with Greip's Fraud Prevention API. Protect your business from financial losses and gain better insights into your users.
\nTo get your API Key:\n\n1. Go to your:
To get your API Key:

1. Go to your Greip account dashboard
2. Navigate to API settings
3. Copy your API key
4. Paste it here
Look up details of an Autonomous System: Look up details of an Autonomous System Number (ASN)
Look up details of a Bank Identification: Look up details of a Bank Identification Number (BIN) or Issuer Identification Number (IIN)
Look up comprehensive information about: Look up comprehensive information about an IP address including location, ISP, security, and risk factors
Validate email addresses by checking dom: Validate email addresses by checking domain validity, detecting disposable emails, and assessing risk factors
Detect offensive or inappropriate langua: Detect offensive or inappropriate language in text using machine learning
Validate phone numbers by checking synta: Validate phone numbers by checking syntax and assessing validity and operational status
The AS Number to lookup (e.g., AS6167 or: The AS Number to lookup (e.g., AS6167 or 6167)
Environment mode for testing or producti: Environment mode for testing or production
Function name for JSONP response format: Function name for JSONP response format
The BIN/IIN of the card (minimum 6 digit: The BIN/IIN of the card (minimum 6 digits). Can be partial like "456789" or full card number
Identify requests from specific users fo: Identify requests from specific users for monitoring (e.g., email, phone, user ID)
The IP address to lookup (IPv4 or IPv6): The IP address to lookup (IPv4 or IPv6)
Comma-separated list of modules to inclu: Comma-separated list of modules to include: security, currency, timezone, location (e.g., "security,timezone,currency")
The text to check for profanity: The text to check for profanity
Return only the score and safety status: Return only the score and safety status
Include a list of bad words found in the: Include a list of bad words found in the text
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (e.g., U: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (e.g., US, GB, FR)
Triggers when a new proxy connection is: Triggers when a new proxy connection is detected
Triggers when a new fraudulent payment i: Triggers when a new fraudulent payment is detected by Greip
Triggers when Greip detects profanity in: Triggers when Greip detects profanity in a specific text
Triggers when a new email is marked as S: Triggers when a new email is marked as SPAM by Greip
Triggers when a new phone number is mark: Triggers when a new phone number is marked as SPAM by Greip
\nTo use this trigger, you need to manua:
To use this trigger, you need to manually set up a webhook in your Greip account:

1. Login to your Greip dashboard.
2. Go to Settings > Integrations > Webhooks.
3. Click on "Add Webhook" or "Create New Webhook".
4. Add the following URL in the **Webhook URL** field:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
5. Select **proxy_detected** from the event types.
6. Click Save to create the webhook.

**Note:** Webhooks are only available for paid subscriptions.
